alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Cape Girardeau (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of western Kentucky and southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in western Kentucky, Fulton and Hickman. In southeast Missouri, Bollinger, Cape Girardeau, Mississippi, New Madrid, Scott and Stoddard. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urbanized areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, with locally higher amounts up to 8 inches reported. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sikeston, Charleston, East Prairie, Chaffee, Fulton, Hickman, Marble Hill, Advance, Oran, Miner, Benton, Bollinger Mill State Historic Site, Big Oak Tree State Park, Towosahgy State Historic Site, Morehouse, Bertrand, Morley, Matthews, Kelso and Bell City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
